posts.title: Actor Val Kilmer, star of 'Batman Forever', dies at 65
top_comments: I highly recommend his 2020 book called I’m your Huckleberry, I just finished it last month. Since he couldn’t read the audiobook, he had three different people read it for him, including Will Forte from SNL. He really lived a great life. Rest in peace.
I am glad we got to see him star Top Gun 2. He was a fighter and held on for a long time despite a very aggressive and terrible disease. I hope he is now at peace.
Fair winds and following seas, Iceman.
Damn. He had so many legendary roles in his career. And great comedic chops as well.
I'm your huckleberry. RIP
RIP. I'm glad he isn't suffering anymore. he'd been battling cancer for so long
Batman Forever is the one they picked for the headline?

I wondered for months before the movie came out how Iceman would be portrayed in Top Gun 2, since Val’s illness took his voice away. 

It was a pleasant surprise how they did it, and did right by him to honor his character. 

One of my favorites from the 90s growing up. His guest spot on Entourage was a hilarious surprise. 

He will be missed dearly.
Willow. It’s a favorite. What a legend.
“Star of Batman Forever”… seriously? Rest in peace. Reuters has questionable taste in movies.

posts.title: Susan Crawford wins Wisconsin Supreme Court race, defying Elon Musk

And the margin wasn't even close either.

FL two deep red districts, while staying red, also swung 20 points toward the Dem.  People are not happy, period.
Fuck off Elon. We hate you.
So proud of my state today!

It just feels nice to read a positive headline for once. 

Congratulations to Susan, fuck you Elon.
Good. Elon's money can't buy everything.

Hello from Wisconsin. Nearly $100M was poured into this race. It was fucking miserable for all of us. We should all be embarrassed that we have let this happen to our democracy.

Fuck oligarchs, fuck big money in politics.
The thought of Elon coping and seething at this brings me great joy
And Elon spent millions on this race lmao
Well now trump is going to go extra nuclear tomorrow with whatever the plan was instead of firing elon for doing a piss poor job.

Imagine being one of the richest people in human history and you still fail to use your unimaginable wealth to blatantly manipulate votes in a state election.

It's hard for me to think of anyone who has ever existed that is a bigger loser than Elon Musk.

posts.title: Sen. Cory Booker’s speech in protest of Trump breaks the Senate record
top_comments:
"Booker broke a record previously held by Strom Thurmond, a segregationist who filibustered for 24 hours and 18 minutes against the Civil Rights Act of 1957, according to the Senate’s records."


Nice

He beat Strom Thurmond. And unlike Ted Cruz, he didn't read from Dr. Seuss or the phonebook, but rather recited letters and personal accounts from Americans. 

Well done.
He's stopping at 25 hours. The strength of this man is admirable. He's had over 100k watching for the last hour.
Over 25 hours before he finally rested. Bravo sir, and may your pillow be extra cold when you sleep tonight.
The coolest part is that the record was originally set by a racist piece of shit who was filibustering *The Civil Rights Act*
Good. Strom Thurmond was an abhorrent scumbag. The fact that South Carolina had him in office until he was a century old is nothing short of shameful.
This was Crazy ……than man has stood up for 24 hours …I wonder if Trump ever stood up for 24 hours in his entire life 🤔🤔
I may not agree with 100% of what he stands for, but will be the first to say that Senator Booker is a motherfucking patriot.

The length in itself is a statement.

Can you imagine musk or trump having the self-discipline to do this for 24-hours?

They'd do it for 13 minutes then say "I think I've proven I could do it"

It's remarkable that Cory Booker is willing to literally, physically stand up for over a whole day, and it's nice to see him beat the Senate record previously held by Strom Thurmond. But, the thing that nobody is really talking about is how he admitted that he is "inadequate" (his word) for the time, and that he does not know what the hell to do. Nearly every Senator who asked him a question to give him reprieve from the moment also asked him what they are supposed to do; which is concerning. 0 Senators have an answer. They are doing \*something\* here, sure. But their response is going to be null if they actually can't figure out what to do.

posts.title: Alabama can’t prosecute groups who help women travel to get an abortion, federal judge says
top_comments:
>“It is one thing for Alabama to outlaw by statute what happens in its own backyard. It is another thing for the state to enforce its values and laws, as chosen by the attorney general, outside its boundaries by punishing its citizens and others who help individuals travel to another state to engage in conduct that is lawful there but the attorney general finds to be contrary to Alabama’s values and laws,” Thompson wrote in the 131-page opinion.

Might as well prosecute airlines taking Alabamans going to Vegas to spin the roulette wheel. Or taking your kid from Mobile to Mississippi to spray some silly string.
"States rights! Except when I want to prosecute you for doing something that's legal in another state!"

Fuck yeah.  Get out with this Christian nationalist fascist bullshit, Alabama.

Women aren't property.  Their wombs aren't property.  Interstate travel is still legal and anyone who tries to prevent that should be told to fuck off, the voters should throw them out of office and a crowd of people in pilgrim's clothing should follow them around every time they leave the house shouting "SHAME! SHAME!" at them.

How long until states get border checks where you cant leave without state visa or minors cant leave without parental permission and minors becomes boosted to under 25s. But i feel like they'd go for trying to get a national ban on abortion instead. They wont stop trying find a win

"Alabama [bans abortion](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/15/politics/alabama-governor-signs-bill/index.html) at any stage of pregnancy with no exceptions for rape and incest."

Dumb Fucks.

This kind of across-state-borders legal wrangling is very similar to that preceding the civil war, only then it was Alabama etc. trying to force northern states to enforce southern laws about escaped slaves.
Always said as soon as they run into interstate commerce these guys' arguments are DOA. It's such a slippery slope, broad argument to make.

The Trump administration is running the "doing it anyway" play and giving a whooooooole bunch of people the go-ahead to do the same.

So a judge might say they can't, but I'm pretty sure they will.
Alabama in a couple years: "We gave you a speeding ticket for exceeding the posted speed limit in Iowa."

You can donate to Yellowhammer Fund here:

https://www.yellowhammerfund.org

I still don't understand why the DoJ is even involved. This shouldn't be a federal case. It should be handled by the state of New York

What a surprise.

And the execution will probably be streamed pay per view on X.

The Parkland school shooter killed 17 people and wasn’t sentenced to death. 

This is a politically driven punishment. 

Edit: I’ve learned the prosecutors in the Parkland shooting trial did try for the death penalty but the jury was not unanimous in agreement so the shooter avoided that punishment. Thanks for those who gave me some learning in the child comments.
Sure, make him a martyr. Go ahead.
Universal Healthcare would have saved Brian Thompson's life.

He sure has heck rattled the cage. 

They really want to make an example out of him but in the end, all it will do is make him a martyr.

Oh they’re scared scared. 

Making him a martyr is the worst possible thing these cowards could do. Good luck with all that.

posts.title: Mississippi governor signs typo tax overhaul bill into law to phase out income tax
top_comments:
I couldn't find what the typo was in this article. So I had to look [around](https://mississippitoday.org/2025/03/24/how-did-the-mississippi-typo-tax-swap-act-of-2025-happen-legislative-recap/). For anyone else wondering:

The latter parts of the tax reduction only occur:

>when revenue surplus equals 85% or more of the cost of a 1% cut in the tax rate.

But the bill was passed and signed as `.85%`. So the cuts are almost guranteed to continue.

Good god, MS. You really are a sitcom at this point:

"The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday."

So they say Mississippi is open for business and a bunch of people will move there. Do people really want to live there with no schools, libraries, hospitals, or maybe even fire stations and police? They already can't pay for these things, what is going to happen with no income tax?
If those Mississippi legislators could read they'd be very upset

These paragraphs explain how the typo affected things:

>House leaders have long pushed to eliminate the state personal income tax in relatively short order. The Senate had urged a longer-term approach, arguing it would be unwise to slash a third of the state’s revenue in uncertain economic times. Senators last week had conceded to eliminate the income tax, but only with economic growth “triggers” as safeguards — the tax wouldn’t phase out unless the state saw robust economic growth and controlled spending. It would have likely taken many years.

>Or so they thought. The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday.

Nothing screams "governing with competence" like accidentally fast-tracking a massive tax overhaul \*because of typos\*. This wasn’t just a clerical hiccup. This is generational economic policy passed by people who \*didn’t read the fine print\*. Or maybe they did and hoped no one else would. Either way, Mississippi just gave its wealthiest residents a high-five and told the working poor to budget harder. 



They’ll tell you it’s bold reform. But behind the curtain? It’s austerity cosplaying as prosperity.
As a lifetime Mississippi resident, let me assure you - we don’t hide our idiots away, we put them in political positions such as Governor.
Stop giving this deadbeat red state more federal money than it kicks in.
Wait until y'all find out [why we no longer have ballot initiatives ](https://apnews.com/article/ms-state-wire-mississippi-marijuana-health-4f81d577aeb2ed8a04849f62c86c707e)

>Or so they thought. The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday.

>In a social media post last week, Reeves, who did not mention the bizarre series of events that helped send the bill to his desk, said “liberal activists” were “making claims of errors, omissions, mistakes, and changes.” Since then, both House Speaker Jason White and Lt. Gov Delbert Hosemann, both Republicans, have acknowledged the legislation signed into law Thursday contained errors.

>Hosemann downplayed the typos at the ceremony.

>“Some of y’all are focused on a typo in the bill, and I’d use the biblical analogy, let he who has not had a typo cast the first stone.”

Damn liberal activists, being right.  Just deflect it and prey on the praying!

posts.title: Medical Student Convicted Of Raping Another Student Escapes Sentence As “He Is Young And Talented”
top_comments: Young and talented at what, raping?

>In his summing up the judge said “It has been proven that sexual intercourse took place at a time that she was in a state that meant that she couldn’t possibly consent to it. The offence is serious and unacceptable.”

>Nevertheless, the judge refrained from passing sentence. “It is undeniable that he passed the line of what is permissible. The man showed a lack of respect for the victim's physical, psychological and sexual boundaries. However, he is still young and has no criminal record. He is also a talented and committed person both in his professional and private live. By finding him guilty but not punishing him, he will be made to feel guilty and the chance of him reoffending will be prevented, without socially impairing the man”.

"Its **unacceptable**! But I won't punish him."

Unfortunately, the title must exactly match the article, so I couldn’t emphasize that the medical student is actually A GYNAECOLOGY RESIDENT!!!!!!! In other words, while the man is young and talented, the woman he raped—and the women who will be vulnerable and naked alone with him in his practice—apparently are not. :)


A similar thing occurred a few years ago in the same belgian courthouse when white elite student club called Reuzegom left their only black member, Sanda Dia, for dead after subjecting him to hours of torture as part of an initiation ritual. He eventually died, and the perpetrators tried to cover their tracks. The verdict was the same: they were found guilty but did not receive any sentencing besides a very low fine of €400 and some community service (in Belgium, you only get a criminal record if there's an actual sentence and the fine needs to exceed X amount which wasn't the case here so they still have clean records) because they were considered “young and promising.” In reality, they were white, wealthy, and one of their fathers was a judge in the same court. A YouTuber who doxxed them was fined €20K—roughly equivalent to 22K dollars—because it is illegal to publish the names of individuals who do not have a criminal record.

Gynecologist that raped an unconscious woman. 

Who the hell would ever risk hiring this scum??

What woman would ever want to be examined by him?!?
That's disgusting. The judge and rapist should both be in prison.
And this is why so many rapes go unreported.  What's the point?  I am boiling angry at this.
If you lack the critical thinking skills to not rape someone, I couldn't care less how talented you are. Straight to jail, do not pass go.
His medical license should be revoked.
Young and Talented? At what? Rape?
Is that how their law is written? Gynecologists who rape women shall not be sentenced to any punishment if they are below the age of 70 and potentially talented.

posts.title: A man wielding an axe wounds 3 people at the Assyrian Christian new year parade in Iraq
top_comments:
“The parade, held every year on April 1, drew thousands of Assyrians from Iraq and across the diaspora, who marched through Dohuk in northern Iraq waving Assyrian flags and wearing colorful traditional clothes.

Witnesses said the attacker, who has not been officially identified, ran toward the crowd shouting Islamic slogans.

He struck three people with the axe before being stopped by participants and security forces. Videos circulated online showed him pinned to the ground, repeatedly shouting, “Islamic State, the Islamic State remains.”

A 17-year-old boy and a 75-year-old woman suffered skull fractures. A member of the local security forces, who was operating a surveillance drone, was also wounded. All three were hospitalized, local security officials said.”
wtf is wrong with people
Good thing it wasn't a Ninja sword or a semi-automatic axe.

posts.title: HHS layoffs hit Meals on Wheels and other services for seniors and disabled
top_comments:
Elon would say this is "wasteful spending". He has no clue what it's like not to be able to buy a meal, what it's like to not be able to go shopping for yourself, what it's like to be alone in your house all day, day after day.

Meals on Wheels is a literal life-saver.

I cannot praise meals on wheels enough. They run affordable to comped meals for seniors and disabled individuals on barebones crews. My mom worked with them for several years. They frequently cooked from scratch with ingredients provided, mostly ran deliveries on volunteer efforts, provided isolated people with not only food and sometimes basic essentials like toiletries, but also provided seniors who could travel meals in social settings. My mom became friends with several seniors at the locations she served, keeping up with their lives until they passed. It was so clear that these services not only provided basic survival to these people, but life enrichment. It is a travesty to see social services like this come to harm.

I saw what my mom and her coworkers went through during covid to keep this service alive. They lost their volunteers and had to manage half staffed. They did it, but it broke a lot of them. These services are run on the backs of hard working people serving their communities. Shame on this government!

My adult special needs son says that helping at Meals on Wheels by handing out the meals to all his "older friends" is the best part of his Community Connections at Day Support. 

Think about that.
Old people who need nutritional support lose needed hot meals and disabled adults who love finding meaning and purpose by helping to deliver the food lose out as well.
This administration would rather those people just die
I hate this so much. For many seniors, meals on wheels might be one of the few social interactions they’ll have all week.
When Elon talks about cutting waste, he's talking about people like this.
Way to go gramps: just had to vote red til you're dead

The entire "doge" hysterics were always going to end up like this.


They can't "find nothing", because that would mean admitting they were wrong. So they have to cut somewhere.


Government spending is very simple. The top 5 categories that make up 85% of spending are SS, Medicare/Medicaid, defense, VA, and interest expense.


You can't cut interest or defense, so that leaves the other three. Illegal immigrants don't collect any of them, so guess where the cuts are coming from?


Nobody really ever paused to think that, from an economic perspective, the majority of govt spending goes to helping old and sick people.
They want to kill off the elderly so they don't have to pay out social security and Medicare.
30+ million spent on golfing so far for Trump already btw

posts.title: Actor Val Kilmer, star of 'Batman Forever', dies at 65
top_comments: I highly recommend his 2020 book called I’m your Huckleberry, I just finished it last month. Since he couldn’t read the audiobook, he had three different people read it for him, including Will Forte from SNL. He really lived a great life. Rest in peace.
I am glad we got to see him star Top Gun 2. He was a fighter and held on for a long time despite a very aggressive and terrible disease. I hope he is now at peace.
Fair winds and following seas, Iceman.
Damn. He had so many legendary roles in his career. And great comedic chops as well.
I'm your huckleberry. RIP
RIP. I'm glad he isn't suffering anymore. he'd been battling cancer for so long
Batman Forever is the one they picked for the headline?

I wondered for months before the movie came out how Iceman would be portrayed in Top Gun 2, since Val’s illness took his voice away. 

It was a pleasant surprise how they did it, and did right by him to honor his character. 

One of my favorites from the 90s growing up. His guest spot on Entourage was a hilarious surprise. 

He will be missed dearly.
Willow. It’s a favorite. What a legend.
“Star of Batman Forever”… seriously? Rest in peace. Reuters has questionable taste in movies.

posts.title: Alabama can’t prosecute groups who help women travel to get an abortion, federal judge says
top_comments:
>“It is one thing for Alabama to outlaw by statute what happens in its own backyard. It is another thing for the state to enforce its values and laws, as chosen by the attorney general, outside its boundaries by punishing its citizens and others who help individuals travel to another state to engage in conduct that is lawful there but the attorney general finds to be contrary to Alabama’s values and laws,” Thompson wrote in the 131-page opinion.

Might as well prosecute airlines taking Alabamans going to Vegas to spin the roulette wheel. Or taking your kid from Mobile to Mississippi to spray some silly string.
"States rights! Except when I want to prosecute you for doing something that's legal in another state!"

Fuck yeah.  Get out with this Christian nationalist fascist bullshit, Alabama.

Women aren't property.  Their wombs aren't property.  Interstate travel is still legal and anyone who tries to prevent that should be told to fuck off, the voters should throw them out of office and a crowd of people in pilgrim's clothing should follow them around every time they leave the house shouting "SHAME! SHAME!" at them.

How long until states get border checks where you cant leave without state visa or minors cant leave without parental permission and minors becomes boosted to under 25s. But i feel like they'd go for trying to get a national ban on abortion instead. They wont stop trying find a win

"Alabama [bans abortion](https://www.cnn.com/2019/05/15/politics/alabama-governor-signs-bill/index.html) at any stage of pregnancy with no exceptions for rape and incest."

Dumb Fucks.

This kind of across-state-borders legal wrangling is very similar to that preceding the civil war, only then it was Alabama etc. trying to force northern states to enforce southern laws about escaped slaves.
Always said as soon as they run into interstate commerce these guys' arguments are DOA. It's such a slippery slope, broad argument to make.

The Trump administration is running the "doing it anyway" play and giving a whooooooole bunch of people the go-ahead to do the same.

So a judge might say they can't, but I'm pretty sure they will.
Alabama in a couple years: "We gave you a speeding ticket for exceeding the posted speed limit in Iowa."

posts.title: Mississippi governor signs typo tax overhaul bill into law to phase out income tax
top_comments:
I couldn't find what the typo was in this article. So I had to look [around](https://mississippitoday.org/2025/03/24/how-did-the-mississippi-typo-tax-swap-act-of-2025-happen-legislative-recap/). For anyone else wondering:

The latter parts of the tax reduction only occur:

>when revenue surplus equals 85% or more of the cost of a 1% cut in the tax rate.

But the bill was passed and signed as `.85%`. So the cuts are almost guranteed to continue.

Good god, MS. You really are a sitcom at this point:

"The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday."

So they say Mississippi is open for business and a bunch of people will move there. Do people really want to live there with no schools, libraries, hospitals, or maybe even fire stations and police? They already can't pay for these things, what is going to happen with no income tax?
If those Mississippi legislators could read they'd be very upset

These paragraphs explain how the typo affected things:

>House leaders have long pushed to eliminate the state personal income tax in relatively short order. The Senate had urged a longer-term approach, arguing it would be unwise to slash a third of the state’s revenue in uncertain economic times. Senators last week had conceded to eliminate the income tax, but only with economic growth “triggers” as safeguards — the tax wouldn’t phase out unless the state saw robust economic growth and controlled spending. It would have likely taken many years.

>Or so they thought. The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday.

Nothing screams "governing with competence" like accidentally fast-tracking a massive tax overhaul \*because of typos\*. This wasn’t just a clerical hiccup. This is generational economic policy passed by people who \*didn’t read the fine print\*. Or maybe they did and hoped no one else would. Either way, Mississippi just gave its wealthiest residents a high-five and told the working poor to budget harder. 



They’ll tell you it’s bold reform. But behind the curtain? It’s austerity cosplaying as prosperity.
As a lifetime Mississippi resident, let me assure you - we don’t hide our idiots away, we put them in political positions such as Governor.
Stop giving this deadbeat red state more federal money than it kicks in.
Wait until y'all find out [why we no longer have ballot initiatives ](https://apnews.com/article/ms-state-wire-mississippi-marijuana-health-4f81d577aeb2ed8a04849f62c86c707e)

>Or so they thought. The Senate bill had typos that essentially nullified the growth triggers and would eliminate the income tax nearly as quickly as the House proposed. The House passed the flawed bill on to the governor, who signed it into law Thursday.

>In a social media post last week, Reeves, who did not mention the bizarre series of events that helped send the bill to his desk, said “liberal activists” were “making claims of errors, omissions, mistakes, and changes.” Since then, both House Speaker Jason White and Lt. Gov Delbert Hosemann, both Republicans, have acknowledged the legislation signed into law Thursday contained errors.

>Hosemann downplayed the typos at the ceremony.

>“Some of y’all are focused on a typo in the bill, and I’d use the biblical analogy, let he who has not had a typo cast the first stone.”

Damn liberal activists, being right.  Just deflect it and prey on the praying!

posts.title: Medical Student Convicted Of Raping Another Student Escapes Sentence As “He Is Young And Talented”
top_comments: Young and talented at what, raping?

>In his summing up the judge said “It has been proven that sexual intercourse took place at a time that she was in a state that meant that she couldn’t possibly consent to it. The offence is serious and unacceptable.”

>Nevertheless, the judge refrained from passing sentence. “It is undeniable that he passed the line of what is permissible. The man showed a lack of respect for the victim's physical, psychological and sexual boundaries. However, he is still young and has no criminal record. He is also a talented and committed person both in his professional and private live. By finding him guilty but not punishing him, he will be made to feel guilty and the chance of him reoffending will be prevented, without socially impairing the man”.

"Its **unacceptable**! But I won't punish him."

Unfortunately, the title must exactly match the article, so I couldn’t emphasize that the medical student is actually A GYNAECOLOGY RESIDENT!!!!!!! In other words, while the man is young and talented, the woman he raped—and the women who will be vulnerable and naked alone with him in his practice—apparently are not. :)


A similar thing occurred a few years ago in the same belgian courthouse when white elite student club called Reuzegom left their only black member, Sanda Dia, for dead after subjecting him to hours of torture as part of an initiation ritual. He eventually died, and the perpetrators tried to cover their tracks. The verdict was the same: they were found guilty but did not receive any sentencing besides a very low fine of €400 and some community service (in Belgium, you only get a criminal record if there's an actual sentence and the fine needs to exceed X amount which wasn't the case here so they still have clean records) because they were considered “young and promising.” In reality, they were white, wealthy, and one of their fathers was a judge in the same court. A YouTuber who doxxed them was fined €20K—roughly equivalent to 22K dollars—because it is illegal to publish the names of individuals who do not have a criminal record.

Gynecologist that raped an unconscious woman. 

Who the hell would ever risk hiring this scum??

What woman would ever want to be examined by him?!?
That's disgusting. The judge and rapist should both be in prison.
And this is why so many rapes go unreported.  What's the point?  I am boiling angry at this.
If you lack the critical thinking skills to not rape someone, I couldn't care less how talented you are. Straight to jail, do not pass go.
His medical license should be revoked.
Young and Talented? At what? Rape?
Is that how their law is written? Gynecologists who rape women shall not be sentenced to any punishment if they are below the age of 70 and potentially talented.
